block.p: Alix O'Reily Peterson and Thabiso Timothy Zwane were married on Friday at the Crocker Tavern in Barnstable, Mass. The Rev. George Chapman performed the Episcopal ceremony.

Mrs. Zwane, 25, is a doctoral candidate in public policy at Harvard University and a fellow at the Center for International Development, a research institute at the John F. Kennedy School of Government at Harvard. She graduated summa cum laude from Boston University, from which she also received a master's degree in economics. She is a daughter of Judy A. Peterson and James E. Peterson of Northglenn, Colo. Her father, who retired as the manager of the Peterson Paint Company, a store in Pueblo, Colo., is now an environmental risk management consultant in Denver. Her mother is a lawyer in private practice in Northglenn and a freelance book editor.
Alix O'Reily Peterson and Thabiso Timothy Zwane were married on Friday at the Crocker Tavern in Barnstable, Mass. The Rev. George Chapman performed the Episcopal ceremony.

Mrs. Zwane, 25, is a doctoral candidate in public policy at Harvard University and a fellow at the Center for International Development, a research institute at the John F. Kennedy School of Government at Harvard. She graduated summa cum laude from Boston University, from which she also received a master's degree in economics. She is a daughter of Judy A. Peterson and James E. Peterson of Northglenn, Colo. Her father, who retired as the manager of the Peterson Paint Company, a store in Pueblo, Colo., is now an environmental risk management consultant in Denver. Her mother is a lawyer in private practice in Northglenn and a freelance book editor.

Mr. Zwane, who is 29 and a certified public accountant, is a senior associate in the Boston office of PricewaterhouseCoopers, the accounting firm. He graduated from Northeastern University. His parents, Gloria M. V. Zwane and Timothy M. J. Zwane, live in Mbabane, Swaziland, where his father, who was Swaziland's ambassador to the European Economic Community from 1973 to 1976 and later principal secretary at the Ministry of Tourism, is now a management and business development consultant. The bridegroom's mother runs a catering business in Mbabane.
